title: WeaRSS - Your News on Wear!
summary: Get news headlines pushed right to your wrist! Send to your phone to read later!
description: WeaRSS allows you to follow all of your favorite news sources and have the headlines sent right to your Android Wear device! Keep up to date with all the news you care about by quickly scanning through headlines right on your wrist. Just copy RSS urls from your favorite websites to build a list of feeds to follow.-- The Read List --You can send headlines from your wearable to your phone for reading later! As you're reading through your headlines on Android Wear, just swipe up to get the "Read this later" button. Tap and the article will be sent back to WeaRSS to the "Read List." Save any number of articles to read later!-- Features: --- Follow any number of RSS/Atom feeds.- Headlines and a brief description will get sent to your device - you'll see the most recent headlines first.- Choose how frequently headlines get synced.- Choose how many headlines from each feed will be sent with each update.- Send articles to from your wearable to the "Read List" for reading the full article later.- Open articles in your mobile browser individually or all at once.- Single or multi-deletion of Read List articles once you've read them.- Choose what happens when you tap on Read List items in the settings.Opening via voice control is supported! After you've brought up the "OK, Google" voice input screen, just say "Open App My Headlines". The app will open showing you the headlines that have been synced to your device.-- Need help adding feeds? --Check out my website for a tutorial on how to get feeds into WeaRSS: http://creativedrewy.comFeature requests? Bugs? Please don't give a low rating! Help me make this the app you want to use. Email me with your comments, questions, anything.Enjoy!Thanks to Cyril Mottier for the Android Wear device frame graphics for wearable screenshots.http://cyrilmottier.com/2014/07/31/android-wear-flat-device-framehttp://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0.
descriptionHTML:
WeaRSS allows you to follow all of your favorite news sources and have the headlines sent right to your Android Wear device! Keep up to date with all the news you care about by quickly scanning through headlines right on your wrist. Just copy RSS urls from your favorite websites to build a list of feeds to follow.

-- The Read List --
You can send headlines from your wearable to your phone for reading later! As you're reading through your headlines on Android Wear, just swipe up to get the "Read this later" button. Tap and the article will be sent back to WeaRSS to the "Read List." Save any number of articles to read later!

-- Features: --
- Follow any number of RSS/Atom feeds.
- Headlines and a brief description will get sent to your device - you'll see the most recent headlines first.
- Choose how frequently headlines get synced.
- Choose how many headlines from each feed will be sent with each update.
- Send articles to from your wearable to the "Read List" for reading the full article later.
- Open articles in your mobile browser individually or all at once.
- Single or multi-deletion of Read List articles once you've read them.
- Choose what happens when you tap on Read List items in the settings.

Opening via voice control is supported! After you've brought up the "OK, Google" voice input screen, just say "Open App My Headlines". The app will open showing you the headlines that have been synced to your device.

-- Need help adding feeds? --
Check out my website for a tutorial on how to get feeds into WeaRSS: http://creativedrewy.com

Feature requests? Bugs? Please don't give a low rating! Help me make this the app you want to use. Email me with your comments, questions, anything.

Enjoy!


Thanks to Cyril Mottier for the Android Wear device frame graphics for wearable screenshots.
http://cyrilmottier.com/2014/07/31/android-wear-flat-device-frame
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0.
comments: I don't understand WHY you have to type in a monstrously long URL into your phone to get this to a wearable.   IF you don't have to do that....then HOW DO you get new RSS feeds into the phone to send to the wearable?    I don't see any "help" button on this app.   I'm willing to pay for this, but right now I don't see it's usefulness.  All I can get is the 3 sample feeds.    Surely... surely, you've made it easier than this.  I'm looking for the "grab RSS  feeds button' so I can go to a site and grab the URL

Works well with Wear Given that the BBC news app doesn't work on my Huawei watch,  I went looking for an alternative. RSS seemed like a good approach.  Tried others which were problematic and chose this little gem. Works well on my wearable.  Love it.

Doesn't synch automatically The app is perfect and does exactly what I wanted. The only problem is I even though I have it set to sync every three hours, have to sync it manually by going on to my phone. I'm using the LG urbane watch.

Unfortunately wearrss has stopped working For the last time!   Really nice app but needs to work on reliability, roughly 70% of the time when opening from the notification, it just gives the error and shuts down.  Uninstalled. Sony z3 & moto 360 1st gen
App keeps crashing Just bought the app bundle for android wear. Every time I try to add a feed, the app crashes. I would like a refund please. If it worked it would awesome, but it doesnt
Great way to read news I would like to see an option to dismiss news you have already read. At the moment there is no way to get back to the first article without swiping 20+ times
recentChanges: --Two snazzy new options for the articles you want to read later!
Send articles from the Read List to a specific app of your choosing like Pocket or Instapaper!
Select your app and share articles to it right from your wearable!
Want to select a destination for each article in the Read List? This option is for you!
Head into the settings for these new options.
